ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Good Morning! REALLY bad news!
ygData.msgSnippet: John Kim has started a thread on this on the Whineplay forum: http://boards.station.sony.com/everquest/Forum4/HTML/062919.html Rokenn
ygData.messageBody:
John Kim has started a thread on this on the Whineplay forum:
http://boards.station.sony.com/everquest/Forum4/HTML/062919.html

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Elijah Meeker [mailto:EMEEKER@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2000 6:27 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Good Morning! REALLY bad news!
>
>
> Below is the whole patch message, but here is the bit that is
> terrible:
>
>
> "This week we corrected a bug that caused regen-type spells (e.g.
> Regeneration, Chloroplast, Regrowth, etc.) to overwrite DOT
> spells. As a
> result of this fix, players can no longer accept a
> regeneration spell while
> under the effect of a DOT. However, if the regen spell is
> already in place,
> the DOT will stack, but not replace the regen spell. This
> will allow users
> of beneficial DOTs, such as Call of Bones, to continue using
> their DOT while
> under the affect of regen."
>
> I logged in Tszaaz, sang Fufills on myself (finally got it to
> stick after 3
> tries) then sang hymn, no message, but the icon didn't appear
> until Fuffils
> wore off. Now, I did not in fact check my hit points (bleh, stoopid
> no-coffee-yet-testing) but that would be consistant with the
> message. I
> ./feedback'd it, that is a significant nerf.Bleh.
>
> Tszaaz/Tsengu
> ================================================
>
